intro: Cupaniopsis foveolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hakea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and distinctive foliage. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. Cupaniopsis foveolata is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and heathland environments.
